title: Ticket #1687: LOCAL_CONFIG_FILE doesn't allow filenames containing commas or spaces
description: when condor_config parses the LOCAL_CONFIG_FILE list, it tokenizes on spaces and commas without regard to quotes. This makes it impossible to use a pathname or filename that contains spaces (or commas). The problem was first noticed in 7.4.3 on Win32 by a user that installed Condor in C:\Program Files (x86)\Condor, but the problem is not really specific to Windows.
remarks:
2010-Oct-04 14:40:59 by matt:
NOTE: LOCAL_CONFIG_FILE also has special command semantics, if it ends with a |, e.g. L_C_F = /usr/lib/condor/bin/gen_config 1 2 3 |, the command gen_config is invoked with arguments 1 2 3 and stdout from gen_config is processed as the configuration.

Let me introduce you to LOCAL_CONFIG_DIR.

2010-Oct-04 19:25:07 by bbockelm:
LOCAL_CONFIG_DIR also suffers its own quirks - it will also parse spaces in name as elements in a list.

It will also parse hidden files (think vim/emacs temporary files you are currently editing) and try to parse them as Condor config files, which has proven problematic at our site.
